attributes.action: make employers recognise apprenticeships as jobs and pay accordingly
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I believe that the government should force employers and colleges to recognise apprentices as workers and members of their company and pay them according to their job and not their title.

I am currently an Advanced Modern Apprentice who has already completed a years apprenticeship in Business Administration.  Whilst on my FMA I got paid a poor £45 a week for doing the same work as other members of my placement staff who got more than the NMW.

I am now in the role of trainee manager and because I am only in the first year of my apprenticeship I am not entitled to NMW despite the fact I have a years training!  If the Government wishes to encourage people to complete vocational qualifications they should encourage employers to pay better.

If you agree that modern apprentices should be paid a fair amount for doing the same work as their counterparts, sign this petition.  You do not have to be or have been an apprentice to realise this is not fair!
